website_summaries.verdict: Decent price for a thick foam balance pad where both feet can be used at once.
pros: and is versatile enough for physical therapy as well as fitness routines
Water-resistant to repel sweat and water bottle spills
Antimicrobial, so ideal considering sneaker soles retain dirt
Surface is textured for traction and better grip
cons: Occasional reports that foam completely crushes, even when below weight limit
Very small for two feet unless placed side by side

customer_reviews.title: TOO THIN
customer_reviews.text: I weight 185lbs and when I stand on this pad it completely crushes; there's no balancing to do. Maybe I'm above the weight standard or didn't buy a thicker piece of foam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small for heel in front of toe balance exercise
customer_reviews.text: Picture misleading. Too small except for feet placed SIDE BY SIDE. Can’t use for heel of one foot placed in front of toe of other foot. I will have to purchase TWO of these which then will be $40 total BUT on the other hand, The density of the foam is PERFECT for a heavy person for physical therapy. Foam does NOT squash to the bottom. I did putchase a second pad. One for each foot
customer_reviews.author: Logical

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have MS and have been in Physical Therapy for a few months. I began using a balance pad there. When it was determined that my balance had improved enough for me to be safe while using one at home, this is the one I chose. It was closest to the one I used at PT, and works exactly the same. If you have balance issues, see your MD to determine the safety of using one. If you are cleared to use one, this is a great one to get. It arrived quickly and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Solipsy

customer_reviews.title: This really works
customer_reviews.text: My therapist recommended this item to help me with balance issues caused by a mild vertigo. I use this cushion several times a day and it has truly changed my awareness of what it means to find body stability, which, in turn, will help me prevent falls.
customer_reviews.author: S. Soloff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Seller
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I use a balance pad when I stand at my desk which makes a huge difference to my lower back. These pads are amazing by keeping your legs and entire body moving at subtle levels you avoid stagnation of the cardiovascular and musculoskeletal systems. Highly recommended for those with desk jobs but, you need a standing desk.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Mays

customer_reviews.title: Started to fall apart after one week but customer service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after one week. Very disappointing. Updating my review to 3 stars from 1 strictly based on the customer service from Vive. They shipped a new product and I am waiting to see if it performs any better than the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The Vive Balance Pad is perfect for me. The size is not too big and its not too small. It allows me to do all of my routine exercises on it to improve my balance and stability. I’m very happy with it. :) Thanks Vive!
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Balance pad works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having problems with balance and walking stability and have fallen several times. My physical therapist brought one of these pads to our therapy session. I love that it works the muscles in my lower legs, ankles and feet really well. I liked it so much, I bought one for myself. Thanks, Linda G. Foley AL.
customer_reviews.author: chico girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad for Ankle Strengthening
customer_reviews.text: I broke my lower leg (both bones, clean breaks) and my physical therapist (PT) had one of these at their clinic to help loosen the scar tissue on my ankle. I asked about getting one and they warned me that they cost about $200. I was pleasantly surprised that they only cost $18.99 on Amazon but did wonder if it would be the same quality of materials and foam rigidity. It was exactly the same as at my PT clinic. I do wrap it in a towel so the sweat from my feet won't degrade the pad material, stain it or make it stink. I highly recommend this pad!
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: I love this pad!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a connective tissue disorder, so I needed something I could have for the long haul for daily use. I used a similar pad for PT. The differences between that one and this one? This one is a bit thicker, which is good for sturdiness. The foam is more dense, so one-legged exercises can be done with more confidence and stability. This pad has a different exterior than the one from PT. Theirs had been shiny, but now it is cracked and squished. I don't think this product will do that. I use it daily during exercise and when I'm cooking. It's quite durable, and our cat keeps trying to steal it for a bed. Lol
customer_reviews.author: C Witt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to regain balance after concussion
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this balance pad to regain balance after a concussion.It is very similar to the one at the physical therapist office. It's the perfect size and my cat enjoys sticking her claws in it,hence I store it in the closet for safe keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry gullickson

customer_reviews.title: Rips really easily, won't last long
customer_reviews.text: This pad is the right sturdiness for balancing etc that I needed. I find that it has more friction than the more expensive brand I use at physical therapy. And this extra friction has caused problems. 1- it won't slide on the floor (good if you don't want it to slide out from under you, bad if you can't move it with your foot for the next exercise. 2- tears easily. My foot slid down the side of the pad, and because it "grabbed" at my shoe, the pad ripped where my shoe caught. It indents permanently easily and rips easily. This pad will not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Ashdro

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, the cushioning only lasted about three months
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this balance pad about three months and I use it to stand on while using my sit/stand desk in the standing position. While it performed well for the first couple of months, in the third month the pad started to lose its cushioning and my feet made indentations don’t seem to be going away. I’m shopping for another pad now and will probably have to spend more money for a different brand. I wish the Vive had held up better.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR PETS AT HIGH STEPS
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a step outside a high step ... I was looking for one for a long time ... and finally found it. Spongy and soft for my tiny dogs feet and sits just below .. before when I had a mobility step too hard with the bumps on it. This IS PERFECT FOR PETS! Also, to help your balance. I am a Pilates instructor and standing on this if you don't hold your abs tight you WILL fall off lol ... a great ab and balance workout. Love it. FINALLY! I would like a little higher also.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for recovery and general exercise
customer_reviews.text: As part of my continued recovery from knee surgery I wanted to have a few of the exercise tools used in physical therapy. This Viva Balance Pad is identical to the one I used and is perfect for my home exercise program now and in the future. I have an average foot size and am able to turn the pad diagonally and stand with one foot in front of the other corner to corner. If you have a larger foot size you may need two pads.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A.

customer_reviews.title: Got flat at the edge
customer_reviews.text: It did not last long. One edge is now at only 1 inch or less.
customer_reviews.author: gomez addams

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one used at my rehab sessions! Reasonably priced, too!
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I've had it about a week but so far, it's sturdy yet makes me WORK to stay steady! It's just like the one my rehab facility used (I broke my pelvis this winter) -- before COVID sent everybody home. I needed extra help with my balance so purchased this in order to keep up my progress. There are exercises in the accompanying brochure; I also recommend viewing the amazon.com video on the product site, as well. Looks easy -- it's not! So happy to have this extra help.
customer_reviews.author: Polopony

customer_reviews.title: Thepad is ok, but the specs are wrong
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pad that was about 2.5" thick to use as a seat cushion following shoulder surgery, to raise the seat level of my chair. The specs for this pad on the website say it's 2.4" thick so I ordered it. The printed info inside the package also states that it's 2.4" thick. The actual pad, however, looked thinner than that so I measured it and sure enough, it's not even 2" thick. Yes, the pad is sturdy and lightweight and priced well, but they need to change their specs to provide the correct dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great for Balance Therapy
customer_reviews.text: I use this balance pad twice daily for my knee and ankle balance therapy exercises. It gives a good balance workout and I like it better than the balance pad used at my physiotherapist's. Sturdy, firm, lightweight, and easy to store out of sight when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Closed cell balance pad is great as an acoustic mat
customer_reviews.text: Instead of using this for exercising, I'm using this as a subwoofer acoustic mat. It cushions the sub and prevents sonic energy from energizing the subflooring causing unwanted rattling and subsonic discolorations to the audio from the sub. The way I'm using this will probably not cause much wear and tear, if at all. I expect decades of use with this method of application. The mat fits a SVS SB-2000 Pro perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Aldebaran

customer_reviews.title: high quality, dense foam pad
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended this item based on an email she'd received from Amazon the day I happened to be seeing her. The price was very good for this item and part of what prompted me to make the purchase. It's been super-helpful in rehabbing my hurt knee! I will say the item was definitely horrendously over-packaged, and the box was open on my porch when I found it. Not sure where the responsibility for either of those things lies.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Small and thin
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist prescribed a balance pads but I could not find one near like she was using (see below). Is sorta OK... I bottom it out (weigh 250#s) especially when I have to do one leg exercises and have to be careful where I put my size 15 feet or I am over the edge. 18" X 18" 3" thick High density foam 18' X 18" 4" thick Memory Foam
customer_reviews.author: the nrkmann

customer_reviews.title: great to practice stability
customer_reviews.text: balance is important with age and this puts you to the test especially us seniors. retraining in balance and gait at home between therapy sessions is a plus to help get back to pre injury status. balance is so important as we age we lose it this can help prevent that with a simple piece of foam it gives a great balancing sessions in your own home
customer_reviews.author: Roapp

customer_reviews.title: Great way to improve your balance
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to the balance pad while in physical therapy. It is a great way to work on your balance without cumbersome equipment. After much research, I found that the VIVE Balance Pad met all my requirements in continuing my my need to attain perfect balance. I do suggest putting it I a pillow case when using so as to keep it clean and fresh.
customer_reviews.author: L A Cahoun

customer_reviews.title: Know what you need it for
customer_reviews.text: I've been in physical therapy during the whole stay-at-home thing. While this looked like a sturdier balance pad than the dense foam from an old dog bed I was using at home, turns out it wasn't as sturdy or high as it appeared. I bought it for price. So, to facilitate what I need, I've cut it in half, stacked the halves, and it works okay. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: DOColt

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking this is not it!
customer_reviews.text: I do 3 sets of 30 seconds on each foot. After 90 seconds, an imprint or recession is left on the mat impacting balance slightly. I flip it over for the last 1.5 sets so it is not depressed. Pad holds permanent depression after several weeks of use. Design needs to be more resilent, materisl compresses and does not return after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: NeutronFlux

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for balance
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist suggested I get one of these to improve balance after a knee replacement. I tried two that didn't work before I found this one. It is perfect as it does not "give" too much.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great for home us4
customer_reviews.text: I had my 3rd on job injury and I still do PT. My therapist recommended me this product. I got it today and it works fine. My injury was a knee injury and my other two injuries were Lowe back and hip injury plus I already have lower spine scoliosis. I will use this in the same way I do in therapy, which is the one leg balance with the opposite leg is bent at the knee. It's to strengthen. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Patients love it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a physical therapist assistant working in home health. I purchased this item to enhance the quality of therapy I can provide in limited and unpredictable home environments. I can't speak to the product's durability yet, but patients love it. One patient has even purchased a pad for themselves to use it outside of PT visits.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in SE Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my parents; used it straight out if the box. Perfect for their exercises and they commented on the quality finish.
customer_reviews.author: Herkgator

customer_reviews.title: Decent support for brief periods.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 200lb guy and the memory foam absolute gives out/deflates to the point you’re effectively standing on the ground after 1-2 minutes. It’s helpful for brief periods but doesn’t hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Was good to use at home after knee surgery so I could do exercises at home between PT.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and exactly what I was wanting. We had to purchase a few items to do pt at home for our son and this is great. Its large enough for him to have room to move around and actually be forced to take a few steps to get down from it. My son also is legally blind. So the color is great for him! Having other colors would be wonderful to as several children need the contrast and especially red which is hard to find. I wish there could be a multiple set price especially for what our needs are.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bosell

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: balance for an older person. It works great and improves balance. Would recommend especially for older people who have balance problems,
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to use on a chair!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to use as a post hip surgery pad to raise up the seat of my chair. They worked perfectly and are in great shape after a month and a half. I just stacked them and put a blanket on top. I’m still healing so I’m still using them. They are firm yet cushiony. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Size is smaller than dimensions given. I wear a size 6 shoe and cannot fit both feet on the pad in its diagonal position. I measured my shoes prior to buying to make sure size would be correct. Sadly it was not. Feel pad is not as soft as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: back pain no more
customer_reviews.text: Using this pad every day has mostly fixed some lower back pain that has been bugging me for two years. I have done all kinds of PT on the floor, stretching and strengthening my back, with limited success. Who knew that standing PT would be so much more effective?
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it just like the one my therapist uses. So happy found it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Salini

customer_reviews.title: Great product for balancing exercises
customer_reviews.text: This balance pad is exactly like the one I used in PT. It's a bit more stable because it's new, but still challenging for one leg balancing. The material seems pretty durable, but I would recommend using it without shoes; I wore shoes while doing calf raises and it scraped the material.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, exactly as described, works perfect for my at home PT exercises. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: JCool

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for thigh/hip rehab
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a recommendation from Airrosti for my exercise rehab plan. It is very cushiony for my boney knees. Very study but lightweight. It can also be used if are working on projects that require you to be on your knees. It's also great if you're an avid gardener. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Romo

customer_reviews.title: exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: if you want or need a glance pad this is the one to get. Arrived quickly
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It survived its arrival to our home, our child’s repeated insults by the means of claws and teeth. It’s unstable but it’s supposed to be. I love the challenge and my ankles are thankful.
customer_reviews.author: jellyinmybelly

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great balance pad, fits both feet at normal standing width apart, and for balance exercises fits both feet at diagonal. Use it also for yoga planks to soften wrist/palm discomfort. Many uses and happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Not 2.4 inches thick
customer_reviews.text: I need a two inch pad, but this is 1 3/4 inches. I am going to keep it rather than return because it is better than nothing. Not happy, obviously. At least the foam is pretty dense.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Height
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I used it for my pet after she had her acl and patella operated on. I use it myself for balance. I would recommend this product if you are looking to improve balance.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Morano

customer_reviews.title: Great stability mat
customer_reviews.text: I've got this math to do leg stability training and i really satisfied with it. Good material and perfect thickness. Mat is not to soft and not too hard, so it is good workout for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dasha

customer_reviews.title: It's wonderful to see my husband's balance improve so much!
customer_reviews.text: After my husband had several surgical procedures he somehow lost ability to keep his balance. His physical therapist visited twice weekly and brought his own balance pad for my husband therapy and suggested he get his own. Well we order it just before hubby's visits ran out. He has been using it every day and his balance has improved dramatically. I decided I will start using it was well for body balance too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for Torch’d
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad working out to Isaac Boots Torch’d. I couldn’t afford his $60 mat but still needed something for my knees and to assist with planks. Thick and sturdy! Perfect for this
customer_reviews.author: Atxgrl

customer_reviews.title: Just like at PT
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the one at PT. I can work on balance at home.
customer_reviews.author: D Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy... preparing for knee surgery and one of the prep-exercises is to do "high knee walking" on this pad. It has been great... even with my weight it does not show wear at all!
customer_reviews.author: Cafecinq

customer_reviews.title: Continuing rehab
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad so I could continue rehabbing my ankle after an injury. I have used this item at the orthopedic center and know how invaluable it is to building back strength and balance. Thank you for making such a wonderful product at an affordable price to help people's lives.
customer_reviews.author: LAURIE GIBBONS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Physical Therapy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It is the same quality as the one I used at my physical therapist. I have been discharged and needed something to keep up my therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Mccraw

customer_reviews.title: It was not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The VIVE Balance Pad deflated and no longer holds it shape. It deflated to half its size. I need a balance pad that is sturdy, durable and strong support as a wheelchair seat cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Carter

customer_reviews.title: Time to balance
customer_reviews.text: I did not rank its durability because I just got it and have no idea how long it’s going to hold up. It’s a little bit smaller than I was expecting but it will do the job for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Lira Z

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Dealing with plantar fasciitis and found through PT that my ankles are weak. This has offered help with balance and improved the range of motion in my ankles.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Essential Part of Home PT
customer_reviews.text: My husband was receiving PT at home. Once that ended, we purchased this so he could continue PT on his own. It's exactly what the professionals use.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Help for my Exercise Program
customer_reviews.text: The item came quickly; I like the booklet that came with the item - good reference and extension for me. Good quality. An item I could not find locally, so a good resource for me. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: So far, it looks durable & looks like great quality and it’s exactly what my PT guy wanted me to get for stability & ankle strengthening
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent balancing pad, be careful not to fall.
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these during my physical therapy to strengthen my ankles/feet muscles and to help with my plantar fasciitis therapy. Make sure you are near something to hold on to while you use this until your ankles are strong enough because you will lose your balance and fall down. I have used this with and without shoes. This piece of exercise equipment is serious.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Turner

customer_reviews.title: not nearly as thik as the image makes you believe
customer_reviews.text: It's not very thick and not made very well. Pieces chip off easily. Not very happy with this purchase, but not worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: I weigh about 185 to 190. When standing on one leg, this pad only seems to compress 1/3 to 1/2 of the way. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: joe m

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Just like the one I use at physical therapy but with a better price. So happy I found this product to do my balance exercise homework for physical therapy ! I have huge feet which was my biggest worry about them fitting on the platform but it’s perfect :)
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for older people who wish to maintain pr improve their balance as well as strengthen their calves.
customer_reviews.author: DickO

customer_reviews.title: a little to small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11 shoe and cannot complete a staggered stance, even turning it the long way. My bad as I should have paid closer attention.
customer_reviews.author: drake

customer_reviews.title: Mom likes it for rehabilitation exercises
customer_reviews.text: This was suggested by health care specialist to assist my mother with rehabilitation exercises after having a foot amputated. 5 STARS
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great stability pad!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having trouble with my balance and this pad is very helpful. There is a booklet with the pad that shows various moves to use with the pad and that was a great idea..
customer_reviews.author: jillybean

customer_reviews.title: balance
customer_reviews.text: good product. balancing and therapeutic exercises on this mat are of the outmost and the pad does produce the effect. I just wish is was a bit longer. overall, it is great
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Thick and dense pad
customer_reviews.text: Very much like this. I do maintenance work. Use this for knees and back for under counter doing plumbing, and anything I need to kneel.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rush

customer_reviews.title: Balance pad
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by my chiropractor. As we get older balance can be a problem. I can definitely see that this will help.
customer_reviews.author: Calico mom

customer_reviews.title: good for older users
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is firmer than some I have used. I do not feel that I am in danger of falling when I use it for some exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The first day my husband and I did some light balancing exercises. I looked down and one of the corners was begining to tear. This should not have happened. Not like we were jumping all over the pad or throwing it on the ground. HORRIBLE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Overall pleased
customer_reviews.text: The order arrived in 3 days not 2 like it said when I ordered it. As a Prime member I expected 2 day delivery. The product seems good, I haven't used it yet. I bought it to use as a balance tool for my patients.As
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for balance training
customer_reviews.text: This pad is just like the one my PT coaches use. I use it for a variety of balance exercises. Perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: Skip McQuillin

customer_reviews.title: PT recommended
customer_reviews.text: Recovering from a broken foot, and my PT recommended this to work on regaining balance and strength. Seems to be working well. Reasonable price, good size, light and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Longboarder

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: The Vive Balance Pad is as advertised. It is durable. It is simple to use and comes with a booklet with easy to understand and do exercises. The fact that it is under $20 makes it very affordable for those who need it. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta J.

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Glad that this item has nonskid surface so that the foam piece doesn't move on the lfoor and also your feet do not slip on top.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huh

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Too firm in my opinion. I feel like I’m balancing on hardwood floor. However it is sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: nice!
customer_reviews.text: This pad really helps with your balance and helping strengthening your leg and ankles
customer_reviews.author: Turkley

customer_reviews.title: I feel that it's a good product that came help me with my concerns.
customer_reviews.text: I had a total knee replacement 61/2 weeks ago. After release from physical therapy, I realized that I needed to work on my balance and core stability. This product was recommended Safeway for seniors. I like the pad but can't attest to it's durability as I've had it for only a wwek.
customer_reviews.author: karen michalski

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. It’s the same one I was using at PT. Getting my hip strength back after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L Strom

customer_reviews.title: Great for balancing exercises
customer_reviews.text: Using this for add on balance exercises at home. Both standing on the mat and also using mat for cushioning the knee(s) for floor drills.
customer_reviews.author: Lhansen

customer_reviews.title: Vive Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to do just what it is advertised to do. It lies on the floor and gives a fairly stable, firm but 'giving' platform on which to perform exercises to increase stability, balance and strength in legs, ankles. The pad appears durable. As with most exercise equipment, you will get out of it what you put in to it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Its what i used while in physical therapy. I continue to do the exercises that i was taught with it now at hone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have been using this for a few weeks and it works great and is durable.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL J.

customer_reviews.title: Approved by my PT co-workers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two for my FIL following brain surgery and 4 subsequent strokes to work on his balance once at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these mats to help with rehabbing my achilles. It's good quality, and is just the right amount of instability.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: good quality per dollar
customer_reviews.text: As effective as the balance pads used at a physical therapy center, at a very good price
customer_reviews.author: Seg2

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product..
customer_reviews.text: Literally only used it twice and it’s already all dented and ripped in the corner. I’ll probably have to get a new one in a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Physical therapist reccomended
customer_reviews.text: great for regaining sense of balance following mild stroke; works if used regularly.
customer_reviews.author: P. Toriumi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last more than a day or two
customer_reviews.text: I'm 205 lbs and use this occasionally in front of my standing desk. It's flattened over time and no longer It's original thickness. Really poor quality foam. Day 1 it was awesome. About 2 days after it's been terrible. I am going to see about getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product. We bought two to use when we deadlift instead of building a lifting platform. Even with 300+ pounds dropped on them they barely concave and they don’t slide at all!
customer_reviews.author: A. Twigg

customer_reviews.title: Let's improve our balance!
customer_reviews.text: This product is helping me improve my balance each day. I have a series of exercises that my physical therapist taught me, two of which include this balance mat. My goal is to prevent falls!!
customer_reviews.author: Auntyem

customer_reviews.title: Used for balancing
customer_reviews.text: Used twice and starting to show wear. Will not last
customer_reviews.author: Beachwood Oh USA

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one
customer_reviews.text: he doctor aid everyone should do a balancing excercise everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Strange

customer_reviews.title: Works well for balance training.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and price. Not so firm that it offers no challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Rector

customer_reviews.title: New knee pain gone
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing when I got down on my knees to work in garden. I had a different pad before that was stiff. When I was doing therapy for new knee the therapist suggested the pad she brought from home and this was just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Byers

customer_reviews.title: Great pad
customer_reviews.text: Great balance pad. Just what I need to help strengthen my torn glute muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie J.

customer_reviews.title: great pad for balance exercises.
customer_reviews.text: Recovering from extensive spinal surgery. Use to do balance exercises prescribed by physical therapist.
customer_reviews.author: button

customer_reviews.title: Physical therapy need
customer_reviews.text: I had one in physical therapy and this one seems to do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry N. Baker

product_meta.title: Vive Balance Pad - Foam Large Yoga Mat Trainer for Physical Therapy, Stability Workout, Knee and Ankle Exercise, Strength Training, Rehab - Chair Cushion for Adults, Kids, and Travel
feature_bullets: IMPROVE STRENGTH, BALANCE AND MOBILITY: Easily integrating into any workout routine, physical therapy or rehabilitation program, the Vive balance pad provides a safe, destabilized surface to improve overall balance and increase core strength. Perfect for seniors and those recovering from injury or surgery, the durable foam balance pad increases joint stability and motor skills, safely strengthening weak ankles, knees and hips.

EXTRA LARGE TEXTURED PLATFORM: Lightly textured to provide a nonslip surface that is safe for use barefoot or with shoes, the balance pad also has a textured nonslip base to prevent slipping and sliding while in use. The extra large cushioned platform measures 15.8” by 13.4”, easily accommodating wider stances and all shoe sizes.

VERSATILE USE: Great for rehabilitation following an injury or surgery, the balance pad is also a useful addition to yoga, pilates and general exercise. Lightweight and portable, the foam balance pad can also be used as a comfortable seat cushion or foot elevator at home or on the go.

DURABLE FOAM MATERIAL: Resilient, closed-cell foam is tear-resistant, safely supporting up to 300 pounds. The thick, latex-free  2.4” foam balance pad is also water-resistant, repelling sweat. Easily clean the balance pad with a damp cloth and mild detergent before drying with a lint-free cloth.
VIVE GUARANTEE: 60 day unconditional guarantee so you can purchase now with confidence.
